char *  varname,
double *  varvalue 
)

Definition at line 192 of file gdatalogger.c.

00193 {
00194         int queueindex,varindex,n;
00195         long int nr,nc;
00196         int FlagQueueFull;
00197         
00198         /* Procura pela variavel */
00199         varindex = -1;
00200         for(n=0;n<pgDataLogger->m_NumberOfVariables;++n){
00201                 if(strcmp(varname,pgDataLogger->Variables[n].VariableName)==0){
00202                         varindex = n;
00203                         break;
00204                 }
00205         }
00206         if(varindex<0){
00207                 return(FALSE);
00208         }
00209 
00210         /* Insere o conteudo */
00211         for(nr=0;nr<pgDataLogger->Variables[varindex].Nr;++nr){
00212                 for(nc=0;nc<pgDataLogger->Variables[varindex].Nc;++nc){
00213                         FlagQueueFull = gQUEUE_RequestWriteIndex(&pgDataLogger->Variables[varindex].CircularQueueControl, &queueindex);
00214 
00215                         pgDataLogger->Variables[varindex].CircularQueue[queueindex] = varvalue[nr+(nc)*pgDataLogger->Variables[varindex].Nr];
00216 
00217                         if(!FlagQueueFull){
00218                                 /* The queue is full. Test if it is the reading head associated to matlab data files. */
00219                                 if(pgDataLogger->Variables[varindex].CircularQueueControl.FlagFull[QUEUE_DESTINATION_FILE]==TRUE){
00220                                         /* Empty in matlab data file. */
00221                                         gDataLogger_MatfileUpdate(pgDataLogger);
00222                                         /* Clear flag: */
00223                                         pgDataLogger->Variables[varindex].CircularQueueControl.FlagFull[QUEUE_DESTINATION_FILE] = FALSE;
00224                                 }
00225                         }
00226                 }
00227         }
00228 
00229         return(TRUE);
00230 }

00322                         *bufferlen = 0;

int gDataLogger_MatfileUpdate ( PGDATALOGGER  pgDataLogger  ) 

Definition at line 235 of file gdatalogger.c.

00236 {
00237         int QueueIndex,nvar,datasize,i;
00238         double *v;
00239         char matvarname[70];
00240 
00241         /********** MATFILE **********/
00242         /* Esvaziar queues de todas as variaveis que vao para o arquivo: */
00243         for(nvar=0;nvar<pgDataLogger->m_NumberOfVariables;++nvar){
00244                 /* Metodo otimizado, que salva em uma variavel MATLAB todas as ultimas leituras. */
00245                 if(!gQUEUE_GetNumberOfUnreadData(&pgDataLogger->Variables[nvar].CircularQueueControl, QUEUE_DESTINATION_FILE, &datasize)){
00246                         return(FALSE);
00247                 }
00248                 if(datasize>0){ /* Existem dados a serem salvos. */
00249                         v = (double *) malloc(datasize * sizeof(double));
00250                         for(i=0;i<datasize;++i){
00251                                 gQUEUE_RequestReadIndex(&pgDataLogger->Variables[nvar].CircularQueueControl, QUEUE_DESTINATION_FILE, &QueueIndex);
00252                                 v[i] = pgDataLogger->Variables[nvar].CircularQueue[QueueIndex];
00253                         }
00254                         sprintf(matvarname,"%s_%li_%li",pgDataLogger->Variables[nvar].VariableName,pgDataLogger->Variables[nvar].GMatlabDataFileIndex,pgDataLogger->Variables[nvar].GMatlabDataFileIndex+datasize-1);

00256                         free(v);
00257                         pgDataLogger->Variables[nvar].GMatlabDataFileIndex += datasize;
00258                 }

00260 
00261         return(TRUE);
